alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 8:34PM EST until January 19 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County. Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Fishing Creek At Enfield affecting Halifax, Edgecombe and Nash Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Halifax and Northampton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Tarboro. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river is at bankfull. At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Saturday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 21.8 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Tar River Tarboro 19.0 18.1 Sat 7 pm EST 19.6 21.0 21.6 20.2 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 845 AM EST.
